intro: Cyclophorus angustatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cyclophorus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
